books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.summary: A novel of the Roaring Twenties that shines a spotlight on the empty lives of the US upper class.

books.title: Moby Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.summary: Captain Ahab’s quest for the white whale is a timeless epic—a stirring tragedy of vengeance and obsession.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.summary: An epic fantasy trilogy featuring a struggle between good and evil in a mythical world.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.summary: A young Andalusian shepherd in search of a dream and his personal legend.

books.title: The Cat in the Hat
books.author: Dr. Seuss
books.summary: Two children sitting at home on a rainy day are visited by the Cat in the Hat, who shows them some tricks and games.

books.title: Where the Wild Things Are
books.author: Maurice Sendak
books.summary: A story about a boy named Max who, after dressing in his wolf costume, wreaks such havoc through his household that he is sent to bed without his supper.

books.title: Charlotte's Web
books.author: E.B. White
books.summary: The novel tells the story of a livestock pig named Wilbur and his friendship with a barn spider named Charlotte.

books.title: The Tale of Peter Rabbit
books.author: Beatrix Potter
books.summary: Mischievous Peter Rabbit, who disobeys his mother and ventures into Mr. McGregor's garden, narrowly escapes disaster.

books.title: The Hunger Games
books.author: Suzanne Collins
books.summary: In a dystopian future, the totalitarian nation of Panem is divided into 12 districts and the Capitol. Each year two young representatives from each district are selected by lottery to participate in The Hunger Games.

books.title: The Maze Runner
books.author: James Dashner
books.summary: A boy wakes up in a Glade with other boys knowing only his name, not how he got there, or how to escape the enclosed walls. A girl arrives, the first ever, and the message she delivers is terrifying.

books.title: The Book Thief
books.author: Markus Zusak
books.summary: Set during World War II in Germany, young Liesel finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others. Under the stairs in her home, a Jewish refugee is being protected by her adoptive parents.

books.title: The Fault in Our Stars
books.author: John Green
books.summary: Two teens, both who have different cancer conditions, fall in love after meeting at a cancer support group.

books.title: Where the Crawdads Sing
books.author: Delia Owens
books.summary: In the marshes of North Carolina, a young woman named Kya lives alone, surviving as best she can in the wilderness.

books.title: The Great Alone
books.author: Kristin Hannah
books.summary: A family moves to Alaska in 1974 in hopes of living off the grid, only for the father's PTSD to cast a shadow over their lives.

books.title: Big Summer
books.author: Jennifer Weiner
books.summary: A social media influencer confronts body shaming, online trolls, and a former best friend who wants her to be maid of honor.

books.title: Becoming
books.author: Michelle Obama
books.summary: The former first lady recounts her life from her childhood in Chicago to her years in the White House.
